direction.raw_text: Caroline sits on the toilet.  Glamour Magazine on her lap. She's wild-eyed and paranoid.  The exhaust fan is running. The aluminum foil is on the sink.  The last little bit of heroin in a wax-paper bundle sits beside it. She's listening hard for any SOUND in the house.  What she's wondering is if someone is outside the door listening. She puts a piece of crack on the foil and listens hard once more before lighting it.  She does the hit. And seems to feel better. Suddenly there's a POUNDING on the door.  The VOICE of her father muffled through the solid wood.

direction.raw_text: Caroline.  Open this door immediately. Caroline is up like a shot.  She looks around.  The POUNDING on the door gets stronger. She crumples the foil and drops it in the toilet. The bathroom door SOUNDS like it's about to cave inward.

direction.raw_text: Who is it?  I'm going to the bathroom. She's coping now, full parallel process mode: she dumps the last heroin on the back of her hand and snorts it, checking her nose in the mirror as she reaches for a can of air freshener which she sprays into the air.

Nobody will help us.  Nobody will take us in.  Nobody wants anything to do with us.  So tell me, Carl, how you're gonna make it up to me. (beat) See my disease tells me I don't have a disease.  That I'm fine.  That it's my birthday and I can have one little drink, then one little line, then one little Valium, then two more fat lines, then two more 10 mil Valium... Six months later I wake up in a sober living house in Philly. And I'm from Dallas, people. (beat) It's a disease -- an allergy of the body and an obsession of the mind. I know that now.  So my name's Marty and today I'm a grateful recovering alcoholic who didn't eat out of a dumpster.  Thanks. And Marty looks to Caroline who didn't relate to one word he said.

direction.raw_text: Come on.  Time to go. The CLOWN tries to catch their attention with some mime, but they ignore him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helena and David are pushing out the door.  The man walking the other way past them is Tigrillo from the Tijuana cartel. As they pass -- HELENA (under her breath) Women's room, stall two. (loud) Should we stop for ice-cream?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! Tigrillo disappears into the restaurant. As Helena pulls out of the Fun Zone parking lot, an unmarked DEA cruiser falls in behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert and Seth are parked across the street from Sketch's building.  They watch people, mostly white people, get what they need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, maybe we missed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you used to bring my daughter here, to this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey man, back the fuck up.  To this place.  What's that shit?  Right now, all over this country, a hundred thousand white people from the suburbs are driving around downtown asking every black person they see, You got any drugs?  You know where I can get drugs?  What kind of effect you think this has on the psyche of a black person, on their possibilities?  If you sent a hundred thousand black people into your neighborhood, Indian Hills, and they asked every white person they saw, hey, you got any drugs?, within a day, your friends and their kids would be selling. It's market forces, man.  The product's marked up three hundred percent.  You can go out on the street and make five hundred bucks in two hours and then do whatever you want for the rest of the day.  You think white people would still be going to law school? There's a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're starting to piss me off.  Get out of the car. Robert and Seth get our of the car and walk across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert and Seth stand in the dim, dingy hallway.  A JUNKIE leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna get me killed. Robert shoves Seth toward the door.  Seth knocks.  The door opens a crack and Sketch's face appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Robert moves around Seth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for my daughter, Caroline. She comes here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a business.  Get the fuck outta here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to find my daughter.  I'll pay you. Sketch pulls a gun and shoves it against Robert's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the fuck do you think you are? Where the fuck do you think you are? Why the fuck do you think I shouldn't just put you in a dumpster?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have money -- SKETCH I got money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay you a thousand dollars.  I have it in my wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want your money, I'll take your money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me where she is. Sketch pushes Robert back into the hall.  Sketch sees Seth lurking there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do that shit again. Sketch slams the door in their face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.  What a good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seth and Robert walk to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I'm telling you.  Don't do this vigilante thing.  Either the cops find her or she'll call you.  I promise. Robert looks at him, carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Javier KNOCKS on the front door.  There is no answer.  The shades are drawn.  The house is darkened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna.  Anna, please.  Let me in. He KNOCKS again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.  You can't stay locked in your house all day. Finally, the door cracks open.  Anna has clearly not been out of the house since the last time we saw her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Javier sits opposite Anna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know this is a tragedy, but you have to realize that good has come out of it. She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Manolo hadn't gone and told them what he did then Salazar and Madrigal would never have been brought to justice.  He did a great thing for Tijuana.  He did a great thing for Mexico.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to believe you.  I really do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will believe me, because it's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seth walks up the steps and into the building.  A beat later he reappears and continues down the street. Robert emerges from across the street and follows at a guarded distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seth walks along the seedy neighborhood street.  He approaches the Villa Elaine.  He turns up the steps and disappears inside. Robert follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert ascends the stairs.  As he enters the hallway he sees Seth pounding on one of the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the door.  Open the fucking door, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes from the other side of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go away! Robert closes the distance.  Seth pounds harder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know she's in there.  Let me talk to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.  Go away! Robert reaches the door.  Seth sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know she's in there. Robert kicks the door in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert sees a middle-aged JOHN in his underwear and a dress shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I haven't touched her -- Caroline is passed out on the bed.  Robert goes to her as the John scrambles for his clothes. She stirs and sees him -- CAROLINE (really out of it) Hi, Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caroline rides in the passenger seat.  She's come out of her stupor and is now filled with ebullience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gonna be great...  I mean, I'm okay and all, because, see, I met a guy, he's in this pretty famous band and... (gets up confessional courage) They've invited me to write lyrics for them, I'm gonna be able to do that and maybe sing, too... not at first, but later. Caroline gets lost in her grandiose vision.  Robert looks over at her as she drifts off into a nod.  A moment later she's awake and rambling again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been doing research for the school paper, that's what I've been doing, like on assignment kind-of, I've seen some stuff you wouldn't believe, but I'm gonna write it all down into lyrics.  They think I'm really good, everybody says so, what do you think? Robert fights back tears.  He reaches over and takes his daughter's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLUB PLATINUM OFFICE - DAY Juan Marquez sits across the desk from Javi.  Tigrillo and PABLO, 30's, are also in the meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Salazar and Madrigal are no longer with us. (beat) A feat none of these people could get accomplished. Juan nods toward Pablo and Tigrillo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to be made the Special Assistant to the new drug Czar, which makes you a very valuable law enforcement officer. (beat) I hope you like to travel because we have plans for Juarez and El Paso, Nogales, Sinaloa, Jalisco, Michoacan... Javi just stares at him for a long moment, then looks off.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OMITTED OMITTED OMITTED OMITTED OMITTED OMITTED OMITTED OMITTED INT

direction.raw_text: Robert on the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cramped, messy office at the Environmental Protection Agency.  Barbara is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm really not sure.  She seemed to recognize it wasn't Serenity Oaks. It's a pretty hard-core facility, but at least we know where she is. (beat) Maybe it's what she needs now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds the phone and doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The court is searched carefully by a phalanx of OFFICERS. Metal Detectors are checked.  Bomb sniffing German Shepherds are led through the space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The agents are unkempt and everyone is tired.  Ruiz moves through a cluttered room in a bathrobe with a cup of coffee. An agent shows him a morning paper -- AGENT Big day. (shows picture in paper) You're a star. Ruiz walks over and sits across from Gordon, switching off the radio show he's listening to.  Gordon looks up from his paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go shower.  You smell. There is a KNOCK on the front door.  An AGENT goes to answer -- AGENT Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mafia.  I've got his breakfast. The agent opens the door and is handed a breakfast tray.  He puts the food in front of Ruiz who uncovers the sausage and eggs. An agent walking by tries to take a bite of sausage.  Ruiz stabs it with a fork -- RUIZ Fuck off. Gordon watches the interchange -- GORDON Where's the love gone, Eddie? You'll be testifying for at least ten days.  What if we stop feeding you? Ruiz begins to eat hungrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You expect me to be grateful for spending the rest of my life looking over my shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That thought makes me feel awful. Ruiz pushes eggs into a piece of toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you for a second imagine none of this had happened?  That my drugs had gone through.  What would have been the harm?  A few people get high who are getting high anyway. Your partner is still alive.  We avoid having breakfast together. Don't you see this means nothing? That your whole life is pointless?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're breaking my heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The worst thing about you, Monty, is you realize the futility of what you're doing and you do it anyway. I wish you could see how transparent you are. (disgusted) This food tastes like shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So go shower already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You only got to me because you were tipped off by the Juarez Cartel, who's trying to break into Tijuana. You're helping them. (beat) You work for a drug dealer too, Monty. Ruiz stands and heads for the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And shave.  You better look nice and believable for the jury. Ruiz disappears into the bathroom and slams the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like having another wife. The agent laughs.  There's another KNOCK on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breakfast. Gordon and the agent look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up.  It's getting cold. Gordon moves to the side of the door and pulls his gun.  The other agent opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with a breakfast tray enters.  Gordon puts the gun to the side of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on your side.  God, you're jumpy. Gordon is momentarily confused, then goes for the bathroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call an ambulance.  Hurry. Gordon tries the bathroom door.  It's stuck.  He gets it open a crack.  There's a body against the other side.  He shoves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ruiz is on the floor in convulsions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call the ambulance. (to Ruiz) Don't die on me.  You will not die on me.  Do you hear me?  Don't you die on me. Ruiz's convulsions get worse, his claw-like fingers scratch across the tile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COURTROOM - SAN DIEGO - DAY The court is packed.  Helena and Arnie watch from the gallery. The judge is at the bench. The prosecutor rises -- PROSECUTOR Your honor, ladies and gentlemen of the jury...  Because of the sudden death of Eduardo Ruiz, the people have decided that at this point we cannot continue our case against Carl Ayala. The court ERUPTS.  Reporters scatter.  Helena cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHITE HOUSE OFFICE - DAY Robert Wakefield enters the office of the Chief of Staff, who looks up from what he's doing, which is reading Robert's report, and is already mid-sentence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, hi -- (waves Robert to a chair) So I've got a copy of your speech here... (glances down, still reading) It's fantastic... So, Robert, my genuine thanks.  You're my choice and you're gonna be great.  The President is sorry he hasn't been able to spend more time with you. After the press conference he wants to really sit down. (an afterthought) Oh, I got to the Post, too.  Don't worry about that thing with your daughter, it's not news; they're willing to treat it as a family matter, a personal matter. (off Robert's stare) Look, even if it came out, we'd turn it into a qualification, I've been in the trenches of this Drug War, I have seen the face of the enemy, etcetera. Robert just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: General Salazar sits in the same grimy cell that housed Francisco Flores.  He is sweating and his breathing is labored.  A DOCTOR enters and gives him an injection, explaining that it will calm him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a reprise of the earlier desert bust... a landing strip in the middle of nowhere, a plane landing, SUV's approaching. This time Javi is at the wheel of one of them.  News crews are trailing behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Javi and Special Agent Hughes stand next to a giant mound of seized cocaine, the same cocaine, in fact, Javi held briefly at the beginning.  The same teenagers from the pickup truck have been arrested.  The news crews get everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This seizure is one of the largest seizures in Mexican history...  It represents the first bilateral effort of the American DEA and the Mexican I.N.C.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: General Salazar lies on his side, eyes and mouth open.  He is dead.  Javier looks at him through the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today I'm very proud to announce that Mexico, with the help of our American partners, is finally winning the war against narcotics trafficking. The PRESS begins shouting questions -- CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEADQUARTERS, I.N.C.D. - MEXICO - DAY Robert and Javi walk through the headquarters, a nondescript government building. Robert extracts photographs of the bust from a manila envelope.  The crates of cocaine are clearly marked "911."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cocaine brand, 911, is an East Coast brand, a Juarez Cartel brand, and you must know it usually comes through into El Paso?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm aware of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's it doing in Tijuana? Javi looks Robert Wakefield squarely in the eye.  He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me ask you a hypothetical question: if Salazar worked for Madrigal and the Juaraz cartel, and he went out of power, would it mean the Juarez Cartel is losing influence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could mean that, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would probably mean the Tijuana Cartel is gaining power?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it possible to have a Drug Czar in Mexico who isn't connected in some war to one of the cartels? Javi thinks along time before answering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's possible... if you're prepared to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An outdoor party is going on.  Children and adults arrive and mingle.  Caterers work the barbecue grill.  Waiters serve food and drink on the rolling lawn. Helena circles through the crowd greeting friends.  She looks past her tree line and up the street where a telephone repair van is parked.  She turns back toward her guests.  Somebody has raised a cup and everyone is CHEERING. Helena drinks with her guests, then walks inside her house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Montel Gordon walks through the gate and up the drive.  He grabs a drink off the tray of a passing waiter.  He appears drunk. Montel follows Helena into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl hears the CHEERING outside and the sound of LAUGHTER. He makes a cellular telephone call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arnie is in his office and answers the cell phone -- CARLOS (V.O.) It's Saturday, Arnie.  You work too hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl, I'm running late.  I'm coming right now -- Behind Arnie in the office there is a movement of SHADOW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl stands at the window looking at his guests while he talks on the phone -- CARLOS Don't bother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Arnie, when were you going to tell me about the 3 million dollars we got in from San Francisco two days after I got arrested?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just waiting for the right time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you didn't feel like you could trust my wife with this news?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just didn't want to take a chance. I didn't want to risk it.  It could have been frozen along with everything else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had it all figured out.  You move into my house.  You raise my kids.  You sleep with my wife.  It was a good plan, Arnie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl, that's insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So my wife is lying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl, think about it, if I was trying to rip you off, I would have left town after Ruiz was killed.  I wouldn't sit next to you in court listening to the dismissal. On the front lawn CHILDREN are lined up for the ice-cream sundae bar that is being tended by a WAITER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arnie, do think there's a difference between a reason and an excuse, because I don't think there is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl -- CARLOS Goodbye Arnie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arnie turns around and there are TWO MEN in his office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl hears MUFFLED GUNSHOTS over the phone.  He hangs up and turns from the window.  Helena is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arnie.  He's not going to be able to make the barbecue. Carl and Helena share an embrace and a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come downstairs.  Everyone is waiting. Carl and Helena turn to leave the room and Montel Gordon is standing in the doorway with his glass of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Helena.  What a great party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody.  I'm a nobody who arrested you, but your wife is a murderer. Gordon takes a sip of his drink.  Two SECURITY OFFICERS appear in the doorway behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you can't be in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw him out of here. The security officers grab Gordon.  There is a scuffle. Gordon falls to the floor by the window.  They are wrestling. As they wrestle, Gordon reaches out and, unnoticed, affixes TINY LISTENING DEVICE underneath the desk. He continues to struggle with the guards.  Helena and Carlos start from the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't win, Helena.  You lost everything.  Tell your children a nice bedtime story...  How you killed my partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guests watch as the guards eject Gordon from the premises. Near the gate David has stopped playing to watch the action. Then he goes back to playing with his toy: a Spastic Jack figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Javi and his convoy of armored SUV's pull up in front of the beautiful house where earlier he deposited Rosario, Salazar's former mistress. Javier opens the front door and Rosario greets him by throwing her arms around his neck.  They disappear inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PRESS SECRETARY stands at the familiar podium addressing the White House Press Corps. Robert Wakefield stands to one side with Chief of Staff, his lawyers, Sheridan and General Landry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...a sterling reputation and close friend of the President, recently confirmed into The Office of National Drug Control Policy... our new Drug Czar, Robert Hudson Wakefield. Applause from the assembled PRESS.  The Press Secretary signals and Robert walks to the podium.  He looks back to the Chief of Staff; he stares out at the expectant faces and television lights and camera flashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The War on Drugs is a war on our nation's most precious resource... our children.  Sixty-eight million children have been targeted by those who perpetrate this war and protecting those children must be priority number one. (beat) There has been progress and there have been failures, but where we have fallen short I see not a problem but an opportunity. Robert is becoming increasingly uneasy.  He glances at the Chief of Staff who bores into him.  He looks again at his speech.  With great effort he continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An opportunity to correct the mistakes of the past while laying a solid foundation for the future. (a long, uncomfortable beat) This takes not only new ideas, but perseverance.  This takes not only resources, but courage.  This takes not only government, but families. Robert stops again as though the words are choking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've... I've outlined a ten-point plan, representing a new bilateral effort... He can't finish.  Everyone stares at Robert.  The crowd of reporters senses something is wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do this. (beat) If there is a War on Drugs then our own families have become the enemy. How can you wage war on your own family? He walks out of the room.  The crowd waits, expecting him to return. Robert walks down a corridor and out of the White House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beautiful spring morning.  He walks down to Pennsylvania Avenue.  He hails a cab and gets in.  The cab pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A twelve step meeting is in progress.  Caroline shares from her seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the good days I feel like I get it, like it all makes sense.  I can stay in the moment.  I don't have to control everything in the future. And I believe everything is going to work out fine. (beat) On the bad days, I just want to grab the phone and start dialing numbers. I want to pull my hair and run through the streets screaming. (beat) But, thanks to the people I've met in these rooms, people like Margaret and Jim and Sarah, people who've taught me how to listen, I'm pretty sure I'll make it through today. Caroline is finished sharing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to share? We pan over to reveal Robert and Barbara sitting next to Caroline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Robert.  This is my wife, Barbara.  We're Caroline's parents. We're just hear to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AYALA HOME - NIGHT The house is dark and silent.  The van is parked up the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon listens through a headset, his expression set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're back up and running. Completely untouchable.  Completely.
direction.name: direction
